reviewText:
Early Access Review

Review written on Sunday, March 20th, 2016

Review  In this Game you are a microorganism and try to beat the opposing microorganisms. You can choose between a few playable microorganisms.
The whole Game is played with 2 buttons. With one button you send Collector, Mine, Fighter, Nuke Units (depending on how long you press the button) and with the other one you can call them back so they bring back the „food“ they collected in the meantime. This will make you grow and win the Game. But watch out if your Units are killed by a virus you will have a really bad time.
All in all it‘s a very colourful Game which has really nice graphics and very simple but fun game mechanics. But to master this Game you will need some time and strategies. Perfect Game if you only got a few minutes to play!
I would recommend you to buy this Game during a Sale for around $1

Rating:
6.5/10

Pros:  Well-made Game
Nice Game mechanics
Simple Controls
A lot of different tactics can be discovered
Works also on older devices
Well-chosen music
Achievements + Trading Cards
Local Multiplayer
Cons:   Game could get boring if you play without a friend
Hardware Information

Hardware   Type     Monitor   BENQ 24 inch 1ms    Headphones   Apple Earpods    Keyboard   Dell Basic Keyboard/ Integrated Alienware Keyboard     Controller   Xbox 360    Mouse   Zelotes T-90    Microphone   Integrated Laptop Micro    OS   Windows 7

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game for the price, difficult yes but leaves coming back because of that. Strategic and fun with every match lasting lesss than 10 minutes. This game though in early access has a lot of room for improvement, getting the core mechanics in with a great soundtrack. Beautiful art design and great physics. You get your bang out of your buck.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Soup is a simple game, but it has fun gameplay. The aim of the game is to win from the Virus, this as Bacteria or Nanobots atm.

Gameplay
You have your collectors, mines and fighters (and you can shoot these torpedoes). These all you can spawn with one single button Z, while holding down the Z button you can see the different units and select them like this. So your collectors collect and grow bigger and on some point you might want to recall them using the X button before they get wiped out by the enemy fighters. You also have mines that circle around your base" for defensive purposes mostly.  Then you have fighters
date: these attack enemies anywhere in the playing field by bumping in them (this eventually kills them as well). As the last unit you can use there is the torpedo
recommended:
well looks like a kamikazerun.. but anyway you can use this to directly attack the virus. Depending on the size of you main body the units you have can be smaller or larger too.

Updates
Looks like we will get updates quite frequently.. Last update changed the fighters and mines behaviour. Mines play more friendly as in letting you collectors through to be reabsorbed by your main body. The fighters gotten smarter
hoursPlayed:
which makes winning a bit more challenging.

Verdict
I'll be keeping my eye on this game
voteText: as I've played it for a few hours now and it was fun to do so (only won twice). I'll be looking forward to things like maybe: being able to change difficulty settings
votesTotal: able to be the virus instead of a bacteria. For now I recommend this game
votesFunny: the price is right and it's fun to play."

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

This game looks simple but is actually much more challenging than you first think. A a fast paced chess game, you must think quick to plan your attack against the oppsing AI to win.
Playing as microorganisms you must strategically take out the other microorganism.

This game also has local mulitplayer and it is definetly more fun playing against a friend as you can have a laugh. It would be really good if there was an online multiplayer adding that extra challenge of playing an unknown player and trying to work out their strategy.

You can check out our play through here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e90cSQnvWIw

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My girlfriend and I played this game together. It is actually pretty fun (specially when you play with someone else) the controls are simple and easy to use (though the control instructions for player 2 are actually backwards haha). For $2 you can't go wrong here, specially since it is early access and should only get better.

Watch our full review here:
https://youtu.be/6kyw6oOkPtM

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nQUICK THOUGHTS: Take Agar.io or Mitos.is, make it stationary 1v1, and you get Soup. The game itself isn't bad, but bare bones definitely sums it up. You have four attacks"
date: one of which collects more bacteria or nanobots to increase your bacteria or nanobot's health (whichever you chose to fight as). Use "minefield" attacks as defense
recommended: "hunters" for a reason I'm still not sure on (I believe gathering at greater distances)
hoursPlayed: as well as torpedo attacks to hurt your foe.\n\nThe gameplay is simple
voteText: though the lack of a tutorial or instructions beyond three explanations on the title screen
helpfulPercent: leave you scratching your head a it. However
votesHelpful: I leaned hitting the x button will also push out surrounding ally bateria or drones to defend against attacks. Even after fifteen minutes
votesTotal: I wished there was a simple/quick tutorial to understand how the game mechanics worked exactly.\n\nThere's also no options menu that I could find
votesFunny: which also would have been nice to help with the music (which is pretty catchy

column17: but it would help. Hopefully some future on-line multiplayer would be interesting. Also would love some more playable bacteria or bots
column18: as well as enemies. Fighting the same virus over and over got boring real quick. Even the ability to play as the virus itself would be nice.\n\nAs it stands
